questions.text: What is the main aim of the Rights of Tenancy policy?

options.A: To allow service participation to determine tenancy
options.B: To secure tenants’ legal protections and prevent unjust eviction or discrimination

questions.explanation: The policy seeks to uphold tenant protections and stable housing free from unjust eviction and discrimination.

questions.text: Which of the following is protected under the Fair Housing Act?
questions.explanation: The Fair Housing Act protects against discrimination including based on familial status, disability, race, etc.

questions.text: Under most landlord‑tenant laws, a landlord may enter a unit:

options.C: With proper notice or in emergencies

questions.explanation: Entry generally requires advanced notice, except in emergencies.

questions.text: A tenant requests a reasonable accommodation related to a disability. The property should:

options.A: Deny requests unless accompanied by medical records
options.B: Engage in an interactive process and grant reasonable adjustments
options.C: Require higher rent for additional effort
options.D: Defer all decisions to service providers

questions.explanation: Landlords should engage in an interactive process and provide reasonable accommodations.

options.B: Court‑supervised process for just cause with due notice

questions.explanation: Evictions must follow due process and local just‑cause rules.

questions.text: Which scenario may indicate illegal discrimination?

options.A: Refusing to fix a broken heater during winter
options.B: Refusing to rent to a family with children
options.C: Charging a late fee stated in the lease

questions.explanation: Familial status is a protected class under the Fair Housing Act.

options.B: Maintain safe, sanitary, and functional living conditions

questions.explanation: Habitability includes maintaining essential services and safe conditions.

questions.text: After a tenant reports code violations, the landlord issues a no‑cause notice. This is likely:
questions.explanation: Retaliation for exercising legal rights is prohibited.
